messages.body:
Hey Mert,

I was just talking to Ryan and he asked if there is a "minimum" on the
number of leads you find each month?

I forgot to ask!

Also, we're interested in trying the demo!

Cheers,
 Jenn

messages.subject: Re: The Ash Design x GodmodeHQ
messages.snippet: Thanks for reaching out! I came across your platform, found it interesting, and decided to sign up. As I started creating my target audience, I went through the process and filled everything out. When
messages.body:
Thanks for reaching out!

I came across your platform, found it interesting, and decided to sign up. As I started creating my target audience, I went through the process and filled everything out. When I clicked “View” to check a potential lead (if I’m using the right term—sorry if I’m mistaken), I reviewed the details and wanted to make a small adjustment.

However, after exiting the onboarding to make the change and clicking “Back,” all the information I had entered was lost, and there was no way to restore it. I had to re-enter everything manually, which made me decide to pause the process. Later, I didn’t get around to continuing.

I hope this feedback is helpful! I’d still love to try using your platform and would be happy to provide more feedback if that would be valuable for you.

Best,

Ella Shteier
The Ash Design
+380 73 456 8700 (WhatsApp)
www.theash.design
On 26 Feb 2025 at 13:26 +0200, Hussein Abou Eita <hussein@godmodehq.com>, wrote:
> Hey, there!
>
> Just checked out your website, super impressive design work.
>
> I saw that you signed up to GodmodeHQ, completed your onboarding and then never loaded a list or set up an associate.
>
> We're redesigning our onboarding, so we'd love to know what happened there.
>
> Would be happy to give you some free credits in exchange for a bit of feedback :)
>
> How does that sound?
>
> Best,
>

messages.subject: The Ash Design x GodmodeHQ
messages.snippet: Hey, there! Just checked out your website, super impressive design work. I saw that you signed up to GodmodeHQ, completed your onboarding and then never loaded a list or set up an associate. We're
messages.body:
Hey, there!

Just checked out your website, super impressive design work.

I saw that you signed up to GodmodeHQ, completed your onboarding and then
never loaded a list or set up an associate.

We're redesigning our onboarding, so we'd love to know what happened there.

Would be happy to give you some free credits in exchange for a bit of
feedback :)

How does that sound?

Best,

>>    had "generate outreach" selected as the purpose of the AI column and not

messages.snippet: Hey Nate, 1. Yes, a receipt would be great 2. Let's jump on a call to discuss pricing! The associates will need less than 15 mins for sure, but we can discuss this during our call. Here's my
messages.body:
Hey Nate,

1. Yes, a receipt would be great
2. Let's jump on a call to discuss pricing! The associates will need less
than 15 mins for sure, but we can discuss this during our call.

Here's <https://gtm.sale/husseincal> my calendar!

Best,

messages.subject: Re: AI Agent YT Sponsorship
messages.snippet: Hey Hussein! Just got a chance to check out the Associates demo, super cool feature. I'm also glad to hear that the video has been sending people over! Love that! Three things from me: What do you
messages.body:
Hey Hussein!

Just got a chance to check out the Associates demo, super cool feature.

I'm also glad to hear that the video has been sending people over! Love that!

Three things from me:


  1.
What do you mean about the invoice? I believe we got squared away at a total price of $200. Or did you mean like a receipt?
  2.
Did you get a chance to review my proposal about a 15 minute dedicated video for $1500?
  3.
I CC'd my new agency email, let's transition our conversation over there as I check that one more often!

Let me know your thoughts.

Cheers,
Nate


Nate Herkelman
Founder | Uppit AI
nateherk@uppitai.com

On Wed, Oct 30, 2024 at 2:27 AM Nate Herkelman <nateherk@uppitai.com<mailto:nateherk@uppitai.com>> wrote:
Hussein,

Thanks for reaching out. I would definitely be willing to do something like I did for Chatling.AI.

For a dedicated tutorial/showcase video, I charge $300 and I would be able to have it unlisted for you to approve within a month. I would also request any details that you would like to have included or specific scripts you would like me to work off of.

If you'd even like to set up a quick call sometime to discuss this we can do so.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Best,
Nate


Nate Herkelman
Founder | Uppit AI
nateherk@uppitai.com<mailto:nateherk@uppitai.com>

>>> 
>>> If you’re interested in learning more, I’d be happy to set up a quick call. 
>>> 
>>> Looking forward to connecting with you within the next 15 days!
>>> 
>>> Best regards,
>>> Dorota

>>> 
>>>

messages.subject: Re: DataStax Renewal
messages.snippet: Hi Mert, Thank you for your email and for sharing your decision with us. While we're sorry to see you go, we completely understand your position and appreciate the transparency. Please consider
messages.body:
Hi Mert,

Thank you for your email and for sharing your decision with us. While we’re
sorry to see you go, we completely understand your position and appreciate
the transparency.

Please consider this confirmation that we have processed your non-renewal
request as per the terms of the agreement. Should your needs change in the

messages.snippet: Hi Mert, Thank you for AWS invoices ! For Deeptraces Inc.'s credit note, it should be an opposite invoice with negative value versus their first payable invoice for documentation purposes of the
messages.body:
Hi Mert,

Thank you for AWS invoices !


   - For Deeptraces Inc.'s credit note, it should be an opposite invoice
   with negative value versus their first payable invoice for documentation
   purposes of the refund payment. You may have received it by email or the
   platform has it in the billing section. If you are not able to reach out
   this we may need to create a credit note posting on the accounting system
   as based on their first issued invoice.


   - Regarding to Uppit AI, yes it seems we've paid $100 on 11 Nov 2024
   which I'm thinking now if it is related to Nathan Herkelman's invoice that
   issued on 01 Nov 2024 in the same amount. Hussesin will check Nathan's
   invoice payment status with partner, then we may have exact info on this.

Best,
Birgul

messages.snippet: It is done - you should have them now! On 25 Feb 2025, at 13:55, Ilan Nabeth <ilan.nabeth@playmakers.co> wrote: Thanks Mert! Any chance you can active us the 100 free leads? Happy to try further
messages.body:
It is done - you should have them now! 

> On 25 Feb 2025, at 13:55, Ilan Nabeth <ilan.nabeth@playmakers.co> wrote:
> 
> Thanks Mert!
> 
> Any chance you can active us the 100 free leads? Happy to try further the tool!
> 
> Best,
> Ilan
> ᐧ
> 
> Le mar. 25 févr. 2025 à 14:12, Mert Deveci <mert@troylabs.io <mailto:mert@troylabs.io>> a écrit :
>> Hey Ilan - yes we do look into it as long as there is a recent Linkedin post. 
>> 
>> You can modify the message. This is just the setup basically. Once you click `Activate` on top right, you will see the messages for each lead (including this one). Then you will be able to manually edit the messages if you would like to do so. We will autosave and send the edited version. 
>> 
>> It will look like this 
>> 
>> <PastedGraphic-1.tiff>
>> 
>>> On 25 Feb 2025, at 12:17, Ilan Nabeth <ilan.nabeth@playmakers.co <mailto:ilan.nabeth@playmakers.co>> wrote:
>>> 
>>> Hey Mert,
>>> 
>>> Apologies for the multiple emails.
>>> With your feature, the Associates, you scrap linkedin data right? Any other sources?
>>> 
>>> <image.png>
>>> 
>>> Moreover can I can modify the email that is going to be sent? Specifically the * * that betrays it's AI.
>>> I can only regenerate and not edit from what I see.
>>> 
>>> Best,
>>> Ilan
>>> 
>>> 
>>> ᐧ
>>> 
>>> Le mar. 25 févr. 2025 à 12:48, Ilan Nabeth <ilan.nabeth@playmakers.co <mailto:ilan.nabeth@playmakers.co>> a écrit :
>>>> Vector looks great, but it's so damn expensive haha!
>>>> ᐧ
>>>> 
>>>> Le mar. 25 févr. 2025 à 12:47, Ilan Nabeth <ilan.nabeth@playmakers.co <mailto:ilan.nabeth@playmakers.co>> a écrit :
>>>>> Hi Mert,
>>>>> 
>>>>> Let's say we start discussing with the person. They ask for a deck. We send it. Then they stop answering. And we loose track, because we don't track all of the ongoing discussions prior to a first call.
>>>>> 
>>>>> Ideally, the AI can understand that the person owe us an answer, and remind us that we must answer to them. (Or just followup, with a simple message automatically).
>>>>> 
>>>>> A simpler approach:
>>>>> We are able to track everything by email, as we use Streak and setup reminder manually. But for Linkedin, I don't think I can add a reminder linked to a specific profile. If I could, I'd do it, to check manually if the person answered within a week for example, and then followup.
>>>>> 
>>>>> Best,
>>>>> Ilan
>>>>> 
>>>>> 
>>>>> ᐧ
>>>>> 
>>>>> Le lun. 24 févr. 2025 à 18:38, Mert Deveci <mert@troylabs.io <mailto:mert@troylabs.io>> a écrit :
>>>>>> Hey Ilan - nice to hear from you bro - thanks for the feedback. I will assign your credits, just sign up here <http://dashboard.godmodehq.com/>
>>>>>> 
>>>>>> Re #2: Is this specific for Linkedin or email or both? What kind of reminders or AI analysis would be most useful for you? Happy to give this to you at an affordable price ($20-30)
>>>>>> 
>>>>>> Re #8: Check out vector.co <http://vector.co/> - free website visitor detector to get the person behind the visit - works only in the US though
>>>>>> 
>>>>>> Met
>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> On 24 Feb 2025, at 16:30, Ilan Nabeth <ilan.nabeth@playmakers.co <mailto:ilan.nabeth@playmakers.co>> wrote:
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> Hi Mert,
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> Happy to apply (and see the quality of the leads generated by Godmode) through this small test.
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> For the survey:
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> I'd say probably 2. We do a lot of reach out with Lemlist. After the conversation starts, sometimes, the lead will stop answering, and we forget to followup, as our inbox is flooded with automated messages sent by lemlist. Lemlist wouldn't be able to tell us if we should follow up or not, since lemlist only automate the process until someone answers.
>>>>>>>

messages.body:
Hey Ilan - yes we do look into it as long as there is a recent Linkedin post. 

You can modify the message. This is just the setup basically. Once you click `Activate` on top right, you will see the messages for each lead (including this one). Then you will be able to manually edit the messages if you would like to do so. We will autosave and send the edited version. 

It will look like this 

￼

> On 25 Feb 2025, at 12:17, Ilan Nabeth <ilan.nabeth@playmakers.co> wrote:
> 
> Hey Mert,
> 
> Apologies for the multiple emails.
> With your feature, the Associates, you scrap linkedin data right? Any other sources?
> 
> <image.png>
> 
> Moreover can I can modify the email that is going to be sent? Specifically the * * that betrays it's AI.
> I can only regenerate and not edit from what I see.
> 
> Best,
> Ilan
> 
> 
> ᐧ
>

>> ᐧ

>>> Hi Mert,
>>> 
>>> Let's say we start discussing with the person. They ask for a deck. We send it. Then they stop answering. And we loose track, because we don't track all of the ongoing discussions prior to a first call.
>>> 
>>> Ideally, the AI can understand that the person owe us an answer, and remind us that we must answer to them. (Or just followup, with a simple message automatically).
>>> 
>>> A simpler approach:
>>> We are able to track everything by email, as we use Streak and setup reminder manually. But for Linkedin, I don't think I can add a reminder linked to a specific profile. If I could, I'd do it, to check manually if the person answered within a week for example, and then followup.
>>> 
>>> Best,
>>> Ilan
>>> 
>>> 
>>> ᐧ

messages.snippet: Number 1, as this is still a new role/pivot for me. I found a snag that Godmode can't help with (yet....) Associates, right now would only be ideal as follow-up managers of longtail conversations
messages.body:
Number 1, as this is still a new role/pivot for me.


*I found a snag that Godmode can't help with (yet....)*
Associates, right now would only be ideal as follow-up managers of longtail
conversations with leads.
Lists need to be vetted and confirmed so that I can talk to them and that I
would qualify as the beneficiary of landing that particular lead before I
can let an associate take over.



*Would love to see the Job search option come back*Jobs == leads with
needs, would love to have an associate work through a outreach flow to find
and warm up the company and internal leads that would have posted said job.
Would love to have set up the associate with background information to help
it persuade the leads, in some sort of hierarchy order, to look into my
client (XDS)

messages.snippet: Thank you Rugved - for your feedback: What specifically about following up with leads is challenging for you? Do you lose them in your inbox after they reply or do you forget about follow ups after the
messages.body:
Thank you Rugved - for your feedback: What specifically about following up with leads is challenging for you? Do you lose them in your inbox after they reply or do you forget about follow ups after the meeting perhaps? 

For mass outreach, definitely recommend Mailchimp as it is a more marketing email rather than sales email, hope this helps. 

> On 24 Feb 2025, at 16:04, Rugved Ambekar <rugved@fraq.com.co> wrote:
> 
> Hi Mert,
> 
> Thanks for reaching out with the new survey.
> 
> In response to your question, the most pressing problem I've been facing is **Following up and converting my existing leads (pipeline)**. This is especially true with cold reach-out. It's challenging to get responses and the entire process of warming them up, qualifying them, and securing a discovery call is time-consuming and often frustrating. It seems the only way to make this viable is to try and handle cold lead outreach in MASS - like 1000s of leads per month.. with GodmodeHQ this is impossible without breaking the budget.
> 
> Best,
> Rugved
> 
> 
>

leads which is worth $100 if you choose to respond.
 
Just respond to this email with your answer, no surveys, no boring stuff. The more detailed your answer is, the better!

 1. Researching my accounts and leads on demand

 1. I hate my CRM

 1. Managing ongoing deals

 1. I don't know how to market my product

 1. Searching for intent signals to find customers

 1. Reaching out to my website visitors

 1. Other: Please specify

 
Mert

messages.body:
Thank you! 

> On 22 Feb 2025, at 16:09, David Fizer <dfizer@missioncybergroup.com> wrote:
> 
> Will work on verbiage for NIST CSF campaign over weekend.  
> 
> I’ll send the 6Sense info over when I get back to my house so you can review.
> 
> Get Outlook for iOS <https://aka.ms/o0ukef>
> From: Mert Deveci <mert@troylabs.io>
> Sent: Saturday, February 22, 2025 10:03:19 AM
> To: David Fizer <dfizer@missioncybergroup.com>
> Cc: Hussein Abou Eita <hussein@godmodehq.com>
> Subject: Re: Campaigns - notes for call
>  
> Hey David - thanks for our call yesterday. Let me know when you have the verbiage for the remaining campaigns to launch them - happy to help you launch them again. 
> 
> Also would appreciate if you can send us the download you got from 6sense so we can see what kind of data is really useful for you guys and Alkira
> 
> Mert
> 
>> On 21 Feb 2025, at 15:35, David Fizer <dfizer@missioncybergroup.com> wrote:
>> 
>> Hi Mert,
>> 
>> Here's an overview of the three campaigns I would like to run with this month's 500 leads. I know this is a lot of information but let me kow what can and can't be done with Godmode and if we need to buy more leads.  We can discuss on today's call.  Thx!
>> 
>> Alkira Infoblox Installed Lead Gen Campaign (125 Leads)
>> Goal: Target companies headquartered in New England area currently running Infoblox (see list of companies sent in previous email)
>> Verbiage:  I need to create new verbiage for this offer
>> Job titles at these companies:  Infrastructure Manager, Network Manager, Network Architect, VP of IT, IT Director 
>> Person: the companies are headquartered in the New England area but the actual people/contacts maybe/can be located spread out throughout the US.  Is this going to be a problem?
>> Alkira Lead Gen Campaign (125 Leads)
>> Goal:  Target companies headquartered in New England area with more than 2500 employees
>> Verbiage:  Can use the same format, verbiage as most recent Alkira campaign, just targeting New England states
>> States:  Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, Vermont
>> Job titles at these companies:  Infrastructure Manager, Network Manager, Network Architect, VP of IT, IT Director
>> Person/Title:  companies headquartered in New England but person can be located anywhere in the US.
>> Avoid:  Avoid companies like IBM, Oracle, HPE and other companies that are actually competitors to Alkira
>> NIST CSF Gap Assessment Campaign (250 leads)
>> Goal: Target companies located in Pennsylvania, Delaware and Ohio for a NIST CSF Gap Assessment Service
>> Verbiage: I need to create verbiage for this offer
>> States:  Pennsylvania, Delaware and Ohio
>> Job Titles: CIO, CISO, VP of Security
>> Company profile:  
>> Revenue - $50 million +
>> Vertical - any
>> Avoid:  Avoid state government entities (.gov)
>> David Fizer
